newsitem.title: UK: RUGBY UNION-SCOTS IN CLUB VERSUS COUNTRY DILEMMA.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-SCOTS IN CLUB VERSUS COUNTRY DILEMMA.

text.p: Scotland are seeking urgent talks with English officials after being informed on Sunday that four Newcastle players may not be released for international rugby duty next weekend.

Doddie Weir, Gary Armstrong, Peter Walton and George Graham are involved in either Scotland's Murrayfield test against Australia or the A team clash with the Junior Springboks, but Newcastle also have an important league game scheduled.

Former England fly-half Rob Andrew, now Newcastle's director of rugby, issued a statement insisting the English club had reached "crisis point" regarding the availability of their Scottish and Irish players.
Scotland team manager Arthur Hastie is hoping a swift solution will be found with the help of the Rugby Football Union and, if necessary, the International Rugby Board (IRB).
"As far as I am aware, the International Board ruling says national teams have first call on players. I hope if there were to be any difficulties, the IRB would do something.

"England brought out a ruling that three England players had to be involved before a club could get dispensation to reschedule a league match. The league regulations do not mention anything about Scottish players."
